intro: Diglyphosa celebica, commonly known as the Celebes two-lobed orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique two-lobed lip in the floral structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often epiphytic on tree trunks or branches. Its flowers are small but colorful, with a distinct fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
